name: UIView.ContentMode
desc: Options to specify how a view adjusts its content when its size changes.

items.name: case scaleToFill
items.desc: The option to scale the content to fit the size of itself by changing the aspect ratio of the content if necessary.

items.name: case scaleAspectFit
items.desc: The option to scale the content to fit the size of the view by maintaining the aspect ratio. Any remaining area of the view’s bounds is transparent.

items.name: case scaleAspectFill
items.desc: The option to scale the content to fill the size of the view. Some portion of the content may be clipped to fill the view’s bounds.

items.name: case redraw
items.desc: The option to redisplay the view when the bounds change by invoking the setNeedsDisplay() method.

items.name: case center
items.desc: The option to center the content in the view’s bounds, keeping the proportions the same.

items.name: case top
items.desc: The option to center the content aligned at the top in the view’s bounds.

items.name: case bottom
items.desc: The option to center the content aligned at the bottom in the view’s bounds.

items.name: case left
items.desc: The option to align the content on the left of the view.

items.name: case right
items.desc: The option to align the content on the right of the view.

items.name: case topLeft
items.desc: The option to align the content in the top-left corner of the view.

items.name: case topRight
items.desc: The option to align the content in the top-right corner of the view.

items.name: case bottomLeft
items.desc: The option to align the content in the bottom-left corner of the view.

items.name: case bottomRight
items.desc: The option to align the content in the bottom-right corner of the view.
